intro: Phlomis fimbrilligera, commonly known as the fringed phlomis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and gray-green, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in dense clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
